title.value: Feature Likelihood Divergence: Evaluating the Generalization of Generative Models Using Samples
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Feature Likelihood Divergence: Evaluating the Generalization of Generative Models Using Samples

extractions.description: The paper proposes a new metric called Feature Likelihood Divergence (FLD) for evaluating deep generative models, addressing limitations of current methods by incorporating novelty, fidelity, and diversity. The authors demonstrate its efficacy through empirical evaluations on various image datasets and model classes.

type.justification: The paper is empirical in nature as it introduces a new metric and demonstrates its performance through various experiments and evaluations.
type.quote: We empirically demonstrate the ability of FLD to identify overfitting problem cases, even when previously proposed metrics fail.

name.justification: The paper focuses on evaluating the generalization of generative models through a new metric (FLD).
name.quote: Generative modeling is one of the fastest-growing areas of deep learning, with success stories spanning the artificial intelligence spectrum.

name.justification: The core contribution of the paper is a new evaluation metric for generative models.
name.quote: We propose the feature likelihood divergence (FLD): a novel sample-based metric that captures sample fidelity, diversity, and novelty.

name.justification: The evaluations are performed on various image datasets, and the generative models in question produce high-dimensional, photo-realistic images.
name.quote: We also extensively evaluate FLD on various image datasets and model classes, demonstrating its ability to match intuitions of previous metrics like FID while offering a more comprehensive evaluation of generative models.

name.justification: Inception-v3 is used as one of the pre-trained models for mapping samples to a perceptually meaningful feature space.
name.quote: Intuitively, FLD achieves these goals by first mapping samples to a perceptually meaningful feature space such as a pre-trained Inception-v3 or DINOv2.

is_contributed.justification: The Inception-v3 model is not contributed by this paper but is used as part of the methodology.
is_contributed.quote: Intuitively, FLD achieves these goals by first mapping samples to a perceptually meaningful feature space such as a pre-trained Inception-v3 or DINOv2.

is_executed.justification: Inception-v3 is utilized in the experimental setup of the paper.
is_executed.quote: Intuitively, FLD achieves these goals by first mapping samples to a perceptually meaningful feature space such as a pre-trained Inception-v3 or DINOv2.

is_compared.justification: The model is not compared to other models in a performance sense but is used for feature extraction.
is_compared.quote: Intuitively, FLD achieves these goals by first mapping samples to a perceptually meaningful feature space such as a pre-trained Inception-v3 or DINOv2.

name.justification: CIFAR10 is one of the datasets used for evaluation in the paper.
name.quote: For example, on CIFAR10, the current standard FID computation uses 50k generated samples and 50k training samples from the dataset, a practice that does not take into account overfitting.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the foundational paper for the CIFAR-10 dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The CIFAR-10 dataset. online: http://www. cs. toronto. edu/kriz/cifar. html

name.justification: FFHQ is one of the datasets used for evaluation in the paper.
name.quote: For datasets, we evaluate a variety of popular natural image benchmarks in CIFAR10, FFHQ and ImageNet.
